intro: Tetragonia kuntzei, commonly known as the New Zealand spinach, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae and is characterized by its succulent, edible leaves that are often used as a leafy vegetable. The plant has a sprawling growth habit and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant, making it suitable for arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features include hairy stems and alternate leaves with a slightly serrated edge.
